title: Fix VAT Category dropdown visibility and z-index issues

requirements.text: Apply CSS fix to frontend/src/pages/Transaction.tsx or frontend/src/index.css to resolve VAT Category dropdown being overshadowed by setting overflow: visible on all elements, z-index: 9999 on select elements, z-index: 99999 on dropdown-menu class, and overflow: visible on tabs, tab-content, grid, column, and card classes
acceptanceCriteria: VAT Category dropdown in Transaction tab is fully visible and not overshadowed by elements below
Dropdown menu displays with proper z-index layering above all other content
All parent containers (tabs, tab-content, grid, column, card) have overflow: visible applied
Select element has position: relative and z-index: 9999

requirements.text: Limit VAT Category dropdown visible items to maximum 3 options at a time with scrolling enabled for remaining options in frontend/src/pages/Transaction.tsx

quotes: ensure only 3  VAT Category items are visible at any time and rest can be seen by scrolling down

acceptanceCriteria: VAT Category dropdown shows maximum 3 visible items when opened
Remaining category options are accessible via vertical scrolling within the dropdown
Dropdown height is constrained to display exactly 3 items
Scroll behavior is smooth and intuitive for users

constraints: Do not modify immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui
Maintain existing VAT calculation logic and functionality
Preserve all existing EN 16931 invoice features
nonGoals: Changing the VAT calculation engine logic
